channel.title: Wildtrain help!
channel.description:
i've searched and looked everywhere for the tut for ::wildtrain, can someone give me a link or give me the tut, it'll be greatly appreciated,
~thanks~

item.title: Wildtrain help!
item.dc:creator: @teric6 teric6
item.description:
@teric6 wrote:

ok, how do you add drops?

Read full topic

item.title: Wildtrain help!
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

They’re nothing, you can modify the range of the npc where it can walk. Leave them 0, you don’t want npc’s to walk, it’s boring.

Read full topic

item.title: Wildtrain help!
item.dc:creator: @teric6 teric6
item.description:
@teric6 wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:4, topic:69864”]You put this above [ENDOFSPAWNLIST] in autospawn.cfg spawn = NPCID xxxx yyyy 0 0 0 0 0 1 Description Change the NPCID to the ID of the npc you want it to be, and the x and y to the x and y coords. Leave the 0s alone and put the npc name in the description so it’s easy to look for it when you want to delete it. You can do as many of those as you want.

spawn = NPCID xxxx yyyy 0 0 0 0 0 1 Description spawn = NPCID xxxx yyyy 0 0 0 0 0 1 Description spawn = NPCID xxxx yyyy 0 0 0 0 0 1 Description spawn = NPCID xxxx yyyy 0 0 0 0 0 1 Description[/quote]

whats the 000001 for?

Read full topic

item.title: Wildtrain help!
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

You put this above [ENDOFSPAWNLIST] in autospawn.cfg spawn = NPCID xxxx yyyy 0 0 0 0 0 1 Description Change the NPCID to the ID of the npc you want it to be, and the x and y to the x and y coords. Leave the 0s alone and put the npc name in the description so it’s easy to look for it when you want to delete it. You can do as many of those as you want.

spawn = NPCID xxxx yyyy 0 0 0 0 0 1 Description spawn = NPCID xxxx yyyy 0 0 0 0 0 1 Description spawn = NPCID xxxx yyyy 0 0 0 0 0 1 Description spawn = NPCID xxxx yyyy 0 0 0 0 0 1 Description

Read full topic

You don’t need a tut for it… you just add some npcs to the wild and make the command.
